fields.summary: Allow users to paste in images from system clipboard to issue comments and descriptions (BB-8892)

fields.description:
Hi,

Cloning from thomasaho/genealogy via ssh hangs. If I turn on debug information I can see that i come to file 125, but then stops.

If I use uncompressed transfer it works.

My other repositories work fine, with ssh and compressed transfer.
fields.summary: Mercurial: clone with ssh hangs
Make shift-enter a shortcut for submitting forms (BB-8893)

fields.description:
Hi,

I realize that as a primarily social coding site, Bitbucket needs to make its entire list of users available (as in issue 6278) in user selections.

However as a primarily private/team user it would be helpful to myself and my team if there was some way to enable the user auto complete listings in BB to at least "prefer" the members of the team and/or list them ahead of other suggested users.  Right now for some of our team users, I need to practically type their entire name before they even show up in the autocomplete list.

This is particularly annoying for the access management screens in our team account when I essentially would always be adding only members of our team (yes we can use groups but there are times when it is easier to add individual users)

At the very least it would be nice if this was an option in the team account itself.  Maybe that would make it a little easier to implement?

Thanks and let me know if I need to provide more info/detail about what I'm looking for.
fields.summary: Enable Bitbucket user auto complete listings to prefer/filter to team members (BB-8896)

fields.description:
Hi from today we see this message and we cannot use our repositor anymore.

Something went wrong

e79b6869c06e4482bb49393ea5fc37a9
fields.summary: Error 500

fields.description: Due to the close proximity of the links, if I have skipped my morning coffee it's possible for me to accidently click "cancel" instead of "submit", causing me to entirely lose my comment. A bit of confirmation would help prevent me from briefly cursing at my own stupidity.
fields.summary: Clicking "cancel" on comments does not require any confirmation (BB-8884)

fields.description:
I have my email notifications (about commits) set to on, but I don't seem to be getting any emails sent to me. I have checked my spam folder.

Last succesfully received mail at 1 July 2013.\\
Last message in site Inbox (same content, commit) 2013-07-01.

This trouble occurs on team account - adlabs.
fields.summary: Not getting email notifications

fields.description:
In activity I see:\\
"calvindhsu commented on a file but no context is available"

In overview:\\
The comment shows up in-line.

Expected example:\\
"calvindhsu commented on File.cs:330" etc
fields.summary: Activity log for pullrequest shows "no context available" even though on "Overview" the comment is available.

fields.description:
I had user name: yurii-btc\\
and in comments it was linking to user /yurii and than with text: " -btc".\\
now changed to yurii_btc, but all records still link to another user in private repo seems very strange.
fields.summary: Comment Author name display incorrectly

fields.description: eta?
fields.summary: ur site is down.

fields.description:
Currently, if you are viewing a diff that happens to have a bunch of autogenerated files that you don't really care about, site performance is severely impacted.

Example:\\
A current pull request I'm reviewing has a reference.cs file with ~3000 lines of new auto-generated code and a generated wsdl of ~2000 lines of code, along with other programmer code that I actually want to review.  This situation basically renders the code review tool worthless.

We've also run into this issue numerous times when we have test files that are in xml (in our case rdl's).

It would be great if the reviewer had the ability to show/hide files at will to improve the site's performance, or some other way to break the diff up into manageable pieces.
fields.summary: Improve performance of large code reviews

fields.description:
Hi Guys

Getting below error when pushing.

Push failed\\
error: RPC failed; result=56, HTTP code = 0 fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly

Which I believe is the post buffer size?

Cheers

Matt
fields.summary: Fails to push to repo , post buffer size

fields.description:
Hi I am unable to push, pull, clone, etc to and from my bitbucket repository,

hg --debug -v push\\
pushing to https://arnoldt@bitbucket.org/arnoldt/msm_eclipse_workspace\\
using https://bitbucket.org/arnoldt/msm_eclipse_workspace\\
http auth: user arnoldt, password not set\\
sending capabilities command

At this point it just hangs.

This was was working on Sun Jul 07 20:55:50 2013 -0400. The last time I pushed up to bitbucket. I running mercurial version 1.9.2
fields.summary: Unable to Push, pull, etc to my repo

fields.description: I tested it with a new user, watched/unwatched my repository, and those events doesn't show up anymore in the stream. It used to show up, so i consider this a bug.
fields.summary: new watcher events no longer show up in the main stream (BB-8865)

fields.description:
Hi ,

I am trying to import an existing repository from a Local SVN onto Bitbucket. However I keep getting invalid URL/unsupported URL  message.\\
The URL is:\\
https://xxxxxxxx.xxx.xxx:8888/svn/project_name

Please help.\\
Thanks,\\
Ajay
fields.summary: Not able to import SVN repository

fields.description:
EDIT: Support editing this issue to request more information for other users having this issue.

Some users have reported issues reaching the site since our migration. To help us understand the scope of the issue, please try the following and let us know the result

* Flush your browser cache and DNS
* Verify that you're connecting to our new IP addresses. Ping us, we should should reply from our [new IP addresses|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/How%2Bcan%2BI%2Baccess%2BBitbucket%2Bfrom%2Bbehind%2Ba%2Bfirewall]
* Try connecting over SSH. You can simply run {{ssh -Tv git@bitbucket.org}} and should at least get a refused connection. This will also tell us if it is just one kind of traffic or another.
* Do a traceroute to Bitbucket and include it here. This will be especially helpful in determining where we should be looking. If you have some machines that function and others that do not, include one from each.
* Post your public IP address here.

We (Support) will keep editing/updating this issue with more information and requested information as we are investigating.

Previous description.

bq. Hello.


bq. For some reason some of PCs in local network can't get access to bitbucket.org. When we try to get it loaded in browser it hang up and show status "waiting page loading".

It appears starting this Monday (08.07.2013).

Meantime we looked to IP addresses resolved by DNS - these looks correct. 'tracert' get reached target IP address.

But we still didn't find what could be difference between PC that can access and PC that can't.

Are there any solutions we could try?

Thank you.

With best regards and wishes,\\
Alex.
fields.summary: Some people cannot reach the Bitbucket.org site after the migration

fields.description:
Hi,

This is in the lines of Issue BCLOUD-3295

The links given are broken. I'm having the same problem in-spite of setting up the name and email on both options>general and remote settings on sourcetree i keep getting

username(of my computer)@ComputerFullName

and not the username <email> in bitbucket

Anyone know where this config file can be edited manually.
fields.summary: Incorrect Author name while Pushing code to BitBucket repository

fields.description:
I have a coworker whose last name is only 2 letters long.  Standard lexicographic order will always put a short word like "of" before a short word like "offer", which is a really good idea.

The Bitbucket mention dropdown doesn't do this, so I can't mention David Ma.  I'd mention him here, but I can't.
fields.summary: I can't mention a user with a short last name

fields.description: "Start export" generates "Unexpected error".
fields.summary: Can't export issues

fields.description:
Just a little design note: I reckon the sideways grey arrows used to denote a 'comment' status on the status page shouldn't be an arrow, it should be something non-directional like a diamond or something.

The up and down arrows are good clear indications of systems-up and systems-down on the messages they're attached to, but the sideways arrow in the "this is just commentary, no change" icon is giving a strong visual cue that isn't carrying any actual information.  So it ends up being distracting.

Off the top of my head, I reckon a diamond the same size as the arrow head would be a nice alternative.  If you guys use Inkscape I could even knock it up for you, just lemme know where to find the original sources.
fields.summary: Grey blurb icon on status.bitbucket.org shouldn't be an arrow (BB-8866)
Bitbucket logo on blog.bitbucket.org should link to bitbucket.org (BB-8867)

fields.description:
I'm currently hosting a small site in one of my repos (ie: myusername.bitbucket.org); however, I would like to be able to link to other repos/projects from my bitbucket site.

I realize that Bitbucket already has instructions for hosting multiple sites: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Publishing+a+Website+on+Bitbucket#PublishingaWebsiteonBitbucket-HostingMultipleProjectsUnderaSingleWebsite

But, if I'm not mistaken, the only way to do this (and have it work on bitbucket) is to put all of ones projects into the same repo, and have them seperated by subfolders. This doesn't make much sense to me...

I tried adding my other projects as submodules to my bitbucket hosted site/repo, but this didn't seem to work when I clicked a link pointing to a submodules' index.html file (ie: myusername.bitbucket.org/projectX/index.html).

Perhaps, I'm missing something simple. Perhaps it an enhancement that Bitbucket could add.

Thoughts?
fields.summary: Hosting static website with submodules. (BB-8868)

fields.description:
For the past day or two I've been editing my wiki a lot, and about 50% of the time when I try to edit or create a page I get a 500 error.  This includes clicking the "Edit" button to begin editing as well as clicking "Save" to save my changes.  Usually when I get the error while saving, my changes are still saved, so the error doesn't make much sense.

This is more of a nuisance since I can just hit "Back" and try again, and it will usually work.
fields.summary: 500 error when editing wiki

fields.description: I'm trying to delete all of the milestones in my project, but nothing happens when I click the "x" button.
fields.summary: Unable to delete final milestone from issue tracker

fields.description:
Would be awesome to have a keyboard shortcut to jump through comments on a large pull request.  At the moment it's a bit of a pain (scroll up - find file with comment - click comment icon - rinse and repeat).

When I get notifications about people commenting on my PR I often want to go to that pull request and quickly jump through all the comments that people have left.
fields.summary: Keyboard shortcut to jump through pull request comments (BB-8869)

fields.description:
Hoi,

I wrote a simple ruby script to check the services of our repositories.

When accessing upnxt_service_AAA I get a 404

Check service url: /1.0/repositories/unifiedpost/upnxt_service_AAA/services/\\
#<Net::HTTPNotFound 404 NOT FOUND readbody=true>

When renaming the repo to upnxt_service_aaa it works

Checking upnxt_service_aaa\\
Check service url: /1.0/repositories/unifiedpost/upnxt_service_aaa/services/\\
#<Net::HTTPOK 200 OK readbody=true>

Please explain, fix,....

Thanks in advance,

Bram
fields.summary: rest call with capitals in name error (BB-8870)

fields.description:
Hi there, I have no access to my new created repository because "something went wrong" : e1dafb5551a5477e9e636d6322a86cf3

You may delete the repos, I will create a new one.
fields.summary: No Access to a new created repository

fields.description:
Some people may have workflows that don't use priorities, so it would be nice if they were optional.

In my workflows, priorities are just another way of communicating _in what order_ something should be done. And since this is already exposed in the UI through milestones, why have both? I'd like not to have to specify one when I don't use it.

Also see http://www.43folders.com/2009/04/28/priorities
fields.summary: Make priorities optional in the issue tracker UI (BB-8871)

fields.description:
Both of the PR's I've tried to merge today have given unexpected errors (see screenshot)

PR's I've tried to merge are:

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui/pull-request/399/firebug-can-be-retrieved-over-https-so/diff

and

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui/pull-request/395/aui-1430-fix-lozenge-text-alignment/diff
fields.summary: Cant merge PR's into AUI repo

fields.description:
Problem: Deployment key grants write access on bitbucket.org.
Situation:
* git.lancero.eu points to bitbucket.org
* lancero is a team account on bitbucket.org
* lancero_leon is my non-team account on bitbucket.org
* I have uploaded a deployment key to that account.
* I have disabled my (write) SSH in my .ssh/config:
Host git.lancero.eu
        User lancero_leon
        IdentityFile ~/.ssh/id_dsa_lancero_trisendo_deploy

$ git remote -v
trace: built-in: git 'remote' '-v'
origin  git@git.lancero.eu:lancero/trisendo-dng.git (fetch)
origin  git@git.lancero.eu:lancero/trisendo-dng.git (push)

I have a script called myssh which calls ssh -v $@ to show SSH log

Now, what is unexpected is when I add a change, commit, then push, the commit/push is accepted and the repository is modified.

As can be seen, this was with the deployment key, which is not in the SSH keys section of any of my bitbucket user or team accounts.

leon@lunar:~/sandbox/sidebranch/openembedded/trisendo/openembedded/dng$ git push
trace: built-in: git 'push'
trace: run_command: '/home/leon/sandbox/sidebranch/openembedded/trisendo/openembedded/dng/myssh' 'git@git.lancero.eu' 'git-receive-pack '\''lancero/trisendo-dng.git'\'''
OpenSSH_5.3p1 Debian-3ubuntu7, OpenSSL 0.9.8k 25 Mar 2009

fields.description:
When I do a git push, this message appears:

fatal: Unable to create '/data/netapp03/netapp03_sas01_07/data/d-985/r-3055985/refs/heads/master.lock': File exists.
fields.summary: My repository is LOCK

fields.description:
When importing a repository from GitHub, BitBucket will lowercase the repository name.

Example:\\
GitHub repository: FooBar\\
After importing into BitBucket: foobar => it should be FooBar
fields.summary: Do not lowercase GitHub repository names when importing (BB-8872)

fields.description:
I've seen the people posting issues, and you have to scroll down to read the coments, and what you see? A bunch of "+1" as comments. So the "comments", instead of being a place for debate and discussion, has become a place for... VOTES.

So what about a button (may be like the stackoverflow, wich is unintrusive) to upvote or downvote an issue (or a comment), and leave the comments part only for dicussion?

From time to time there are good ideas in the comments too, and we can avoid the: me too, +1, it's a good idea, etc...

Regards,
fields.summary: Put a button to up/down vote for an issue

fields.description:
This is likely a wider issue, but manifests itself pretty well when trying to search for 'pypy'. Steps to reproduce

# Open bitbucket.org, click on owner/repository search box in the title bar
# Type 'pyp' (attached screenshot pyp.png). In this case search produces fairly reasonable matches, correctly including some with 'pypy' in it.
# Type 'pypy' (attached screenshot pypy.png). In this case, search results don't include pypy at all. Expected result is that those repositories (including the main one at pypy/pypy) should show up right at the top of the list.
fields.summary: Strange search results for 'pypy' (BB-8873)

fields.description:
in issue BCLOUD-3273 this bug was first reported, but only for hex color codes inside of code blocks.\\
but this is also an issue in normal issue content.

lets take for example the hex color # 3c9ec5 it would link this issue to issue 3 (see screenshot)

of course one could argue, "such color codes should be in a code block anyway".\\
but I think this issue is still worth having a look at (especially since at lest on my projects the issue tracker is used by non developers as well)
fields.summary: Issue link renderer is too eager and will try to render color hashes (outside of code blocks) (BB-8874)
Non-ASCII characters make TOC macro sad (BB-8875)

fields.description:
When I try to filter the commits showing all commits up to a a bookmark ("::myBookmark"), or if I search for a non-existing bookmark ("::nonExisitingBookmark")  the server responds with a 500 error.

How to reproduce:\\
Assume that "myBookmark" is a bookmark in your repo.\\
Filtering for "::myBookmark" will cause the problem.
fields.summary: Filtering commits by "::something" can cause 500er errors (BB-8876)

fields.description:
Since I have to look at this error message all the time:

Unable to merge\\
An unexpected error occurred

{code}

{code}

It doesn't provide any real value, so it might as well be entertaining.

Suggestions:

Unable to merge\\
Look inward for the answer

Unable to merge\\
This is not the commit your looking for

Unable to merge\\
The FCC will not allow this merge

Unable to merge\\
Its not you, its us
fields.summary: Create entertaining error messages

fields.description: Pull Request are great tooll and i would like to be able to reverse a hunk of the file (similar to what i can do in SourceTree) direclty from Bitbucket.
fields.summary: Reverse hunk (BB-8859)

fields.description:
seems from the beginning of June it becomes very slow and instable in china.

some times we can push code to bitbucket, and the speed is normal, but some times we cannot access site. and cannot connect server when push code.\\
please see the following error message:

{code}
#!bash
$ git push origin master 
ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Connection timed out
fatal: The remote end hung up unexpectedly
{code}

Right now, we can only use proxy to access and push code to bitbucket.

Is there any way to solve this problem?
fields.summary: we cannot access and push code in china?

fields.description: Sometimes can't open the site and Push in China do you have any solution?
fields.summary: China cannot use the bitbucket. Org What's the good way?

fields.description:
When exporting issues, the ones marked as spam won't be exported (by design). There should be an option to allow this for cases where there may be a large number of false positives.

Note that this will not allow these issues to be imported into another repo, as the importer will once again spam-check everything again, immediately flagging everything as spam.
fields.summary: Allow users to export issues that are marked as spam (BB-8857)

fields.description: When browsing source directories, large files may cause that specific directory to fail and return a 500. This is due to the way some of the properties of these files are gathered. For example, a file > 1GB of text may take Git longer than 30 seconds to produce a size or stat for. Because we have a hard timeout of 30 seconds for any request, this page will fail.
fields.summary: Large files can cause the source browser or commit view to become unresponsive or 500 (BB-8856)

fields.description: When adding and removing users in the Administration of Groups and Users, a request may timeout or the page may be unresponsive for users of 100+ user accounts.
fields.summary: Group management for 100+ user accounts may be slow or unresponsive (BB-8855)

fields.summary: Errors received in our repo

fields.description: When creating a new repository, the site suggests running {{git remote add origin ssh://git@bitbucket.org/[…]}}, which sets up an {{ssh}} remote. It is not obvious right away how to set up an HTTPS remote instead.
fields.summary: Getting the HTTPS URL for a new repository could be easier

fields.description: Editing Wiki via web UI creates new entry ({{created wiki-page}}, {{edited wiki-page}} etc.) to Newsfeed and repository's Recent Activity feed. The problem is when cloning Wiki, then edit it offline and pushing changes back to Bitbucket these two feeds are not updating.
fields.summary: Pushing changes to Wiki does not generate new entries in Newsfeed and repository's Recent Activity feed (BB-8944)

fields.description:
Hi,\\
I can auto close issues in one of my private repos. However, it does not work on two others (public and private), even though the settings are exactly the same..\\
Any idea?

Thanks,\\
Tate
fields.summary: Issue tracker auto closing does not work

fields.description:
I have a private repository. But when a pull request is created and we're trying to add Reviewers search find all people in bitbucket, which is very confusing. Instead we would like to be able to just find people on the team (without searching anybody who's not on the team).

Is this possible?
fields.summary: Limit pull request reviewers search to only people in the team

fields.description:
When a user comments on a pull request on a line of code that isn't shown by default (e.g., isn't in the near vicinity of the committed changes) it's unclear where in the file the comment is located.

The only indication that there is a comment appears to be the number next to the comment icon which, if clicked, scrolls the page slightly but does not reveal the comment.

This may not be a bug per se, but coming recently from Crucible which showed comments on skipped lines in gray italics it's something I miss.   At the very least I think clicking a link for the comment should take you to where you can see it without having to click one of several ellipses buttons (and guessing which one, at that).
fields.summary: Comments hidden in pull requests (BB-8853)

fields.description:
It would be great if the _include_ directive worked in the source browser.

The documentation for it is at http://docutils.sourceforge.net/docs/ref/rst/directives.html#including-an-external-document-fragment and an example of where I would like it to work is at https://bitbucket.org/volumesoffun/polyvox/src/master/documentation/changelog.rst
fields.summary: Add support for 'include' directive in reStructuredText preview in source browser (BB-8854)

fields.description:
Getting an error on this page:

https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui/pull-request/382/aui-1608-re-request-progress-data-set/diff

Not sure why but it seems to have happened after the latest commit (activity is also giving an error)
fields.summary: AUI PR diff not showing up

fields.description: Shouldn't it always be Atlassian Bitbucket?
fields.summary: Bitbucket goes from Atlassian Bitbucket to Vanilla Bitbucket logo upon login

fields.description:
I'm trying to access this issue:

https://bitbucket.org/monwara/django-url-tools/issue/1/toggle_params

It consistently gives me a 500 for a few days now. The issue started on June 28th, when I tried to post a reply to a comment. Status page has been all green.
fields.summary: Markdown consistently fails to render content within 30s timelimit (BB-8929)

fields.description:
../../userprog/syscallprocess.c: In function âsys_forkâ:\\
../../userprog/syscallprocess.c:81: warning: passing argument 3 of âthread_forkâ makes integer from pointer without a cast\\
../../userprog/syscallprocess.c:79: warning: unused variable âparentâ\\
../../userprog/syscallprocess.c: At top level:\\
../../userprog/syscallprocess.c:14: warning: âforklockâ defined but not used

../../userprog/runprogram.c:218: warning: unused parameter âexecvargsâ
fields.summary: Compiler Warnings on execv args and fork

fields.description:
I created an account and use the char '£' within my password.

When I tried to do a 'git clone' I had an authentifcation error.

Once my password has changed (changing '£' char by another one, everything worked).

I think that char is a special one wich can do some unexpected error so I wanted to tell you.

Regards,\\
Axel.
fields.summary: Bad char in password account (BB-8852)

fields.description: Could you please add Xojo (formerly Realbasic) to the available language options for repositories? I'm more than happy to help with syntax highlighting if necessary.
fields.summary: Add Xojo to repository language options

fields.description:
Hey guys,

Back in April you announced better email notifications and I like them I really do.  What I (and a few of the people on my team) would like to see is the actual commits in the commit summary email.  Or rather, an option to include them.

The current email sends you a nice looking summary, but we'd really like to see that with the actual commits in there - maybe even just the files changed and the message from git log.

I'm referring to this blog post:  http://blog.bitbucket.org/2013/05/07/beautiful-and-relevant-notifications/

Sorry if this is a duplicate, I looked but didn't see anything.\\
__Andy
fields.summary: Email notification for commits should include the commit. (BB-8835)

fields.description: See [BB-8834|https://bitbucket.atlassian.net/browse/BB-8834]
fields.summary: Paginate long diffs on Pull Requests and Commit views (BB-8834)

fields.description: Our team uses Google for signing into Bitbucket and we noticed that when a new user does this, their Bitbucket account does not get populated with their first or last name info (under Account settings).  It would be nice if these fields could be auto-populated from the Google sign in data.
fields.summary: Automatically set first/last names in Bitbucket when creating an account via Google sign in (BB-8836)

fields.description:
The width of the code window does not re-size with the browser width.  If the file being reviewed contains lines of code that exceed the width of the code window and the file is longer vertically than the page, this requires you to scroll down to the bottom of the file and lose your place just to scroll over horizontally.

This makes it very hard to review code that runs off the screen horizontally.

If the code window can't be re-sized, perhaps a word-wrap feature could be added.
fields.summary: Code window width doesn't re-size with browser (BB-8837)

fields.description: I'm getting a 500 error accessing https://bitbucket.org/monwara/django-url-tools/issue/1/toggle_params.
fields.summary: Issue markup rendering times out sometimes (BB-8838)

fields.description: In short, it is very hard to manage a large amount of pull requests with multiple reviewers. For example, User A might approve a pull request, while user B might have concerns. User C updates their pull request with a new commit. At this point User A should have to review again, but at the moment their approval is retained.
fields.summary: Further commits on a pull request should remove any prior approvals (BB-6784)

It makes it really hard to have the above the fold content fit into the first 14kb for a fast load on 3g.\\
Please add gzip/deflate at least as an option.

fields.description:
When I try to enter the subdomain name pointing to bitbucket.org on the Custom domain page, I get the error message "DNS did not resolve." just below the CNAME box. This is different than the message I get when I enter an incorrect address: "The hostname "_________" does not resolve to bitbucket.org. Please check your DNS settings. Your hostname currently points to ___________."

The CNAME used to work, and I haven't touched the DNS records in months. A DNS propagation checker confirms that it has been set correctly on my end and propagated.

Either the error message is incorrect or it should be more specific as to what the problem is.
fields.summary: "DNS did not resolve" error message on custom CNAME feature

fields.description: Pushing to a public Mercurial wiki over https is presently broken. We're working to fix it asap.

fields.description: there's a /user/repositories endpoint, but no way to do this for a group or team.  Would be nice to see all repos that are owned by a team.
fields.summary: use api to get repositories by team name

fields.description:
Hi all,

I am having an issue to access the repository https://bitbucket.org/telestax/telscale-load-balancer. I get a "500 Something went wrong" page with debug id: 9567b3e548db40eab5979a01410b2cce.

Recently, i created a second user and fixed ssh-keys according to: https://confluence.atlassian.com/pages/viewpage.action?pageId=271943168.

My ~/.ssh/config defines one alias for the second username and points to the second ssh identity.

So for the repositories the belong to the second user, i use git@ALIAS instead of git@bitbucket.org and this is working ok.

For the repositories that belong to the first user, i use the standard git@bitbucket.org.... url but still i can see from the notification emails, that commits are from the second username.

Each user contains the appropriate ssh-keys. User1 has ssh-key1 configured and User2 has key2. So even if something wrong happened locally, bitbucket shouldn't accept my commits to a repo that the user doesn't have permissions.

I think thats the reason the repository i mention earlier is not working.

Thanks\\
George
fields.summary: Repository not accessible and multiple ssh identities issue

fields.description:
For working with feature branches in Mercurial, I think it would be useful if the POST service would send not just the node of the newly pushed changesets, but also the names of any bookmarks pushed.

That way I could put the bookmark name into the branch field of the change I'm sending to my Buildbot instance. That would in turn allow me to configure listeners to different feature branches.
fields.summary: Send current bookmark with POST (BB-8828)

fields.description:
Push commit notification RSS entries link to project/commits/all and the individual commits listed with their SHA are not linked.

It would be helpful to have links to the commits themselves in the entry. For single-commit pushes it might even be good to have the entry's main link go to the specific commit.
fields.summary: In RSS feeds, commit SHAs would be better hyperlinked (BB-8827)

The error code issued was: cf6bbd89294746929b6b247d96283d52

fields.description:
Hello!

It would be marvellous if the documentation for the JIRA DVCS Connector plugin was improved.

I think it would be useful to have a section explaining in more detail the set-up of the plugin, especially pairing the GitHub account to the plugin especially what is necessary in the OAuth callback and main url fields on GitHub (necessary on Bitbucket too if I remember correctly?)

These are relatively clear for people with somewhat background with OAuth, but otherwise you might struggle a bit.

Thanks!

James

From this page: [https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.jira.plugins.jira-bitbucket-connector-plugin], if you click on the documentation link you end up here: [https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using+the+JIRA+DVCS+Connector+Plugin|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Using%2Bthe%2BJIRA%2BDVCS%2BConnector%2BPlugin].

This would be marvellous if this could be fixed!

Thanks!

James

fields.summary: Remove filters from the issue list (BB-8821)

fields.description:
Github.com allows people to host pages on their custom domain and that may include not just static html but also blogs based on jekyll and hackyll see an example: http://bibhas.in

Sourceforge also allows people to host sites and pages even forums and blog sites that have a database

This is what bitbucket does not allow, and lack of this feature has put me off as because with bitbucket I cannot have my own project's good looking start/home page in bitbucket which I can still have in both Sourceforge and Github

In bitbucket the project's home page provided on a custom domain - which I will get for my project looks like a scientist's diary and I cannot show this to normal/newbie people who will be visiting my software project's homepage to know about it, I need a better looking startpage and hence I have decided to switch to github currently for this project.

if in future it allows the same, please let me know, I may create another project here.. just because bitbucket allows private repos which github doesnt allow yet on the free quota.
fields.summary: Bitbucket does not have pages/flatfile site hosting like Github and Sourceforge

fields.description:
*Expected behavior*

The Creole {{<<toc / 1>>}} tag is supposed to show the level 1 headers from all other Wiki files in the same folder.

*Observed behavior*

Level 1 headers _inside code blocks_ in markdown files are processed, but they should not be.

http://daringfireball.net/projects/markdown/syntax#precode

* "Regular Markdown syntax is not processed within code blocks. E.g., asterisks are just literal asterisks within a code block. This means it’s also easy to use Markdown to write about Markdown’s own syntax."

For example, if one of my wiki markdown files contains this text:

{code}
```bash
#!/bin/bash
# myscript.sh

echo "Hi there :)"
```
{code}

then the table of contents in a second file produced by using the Creole tag {{<<toc / 1>>}} will contain a listing called "myscript.sh" when it should not.

I assume this problem arises because a simple regular expression is used to find all level 1 headers. A more sophisticated parsing approach should be used instead to avoid processing level 1 headers inside code blocks.
fields.summary: Level 1 headers inside code blocks should not be processed (BB-8822)

fields.description:
hi!

While any other section of the site works, appearing logged in, the download page sees me as not being logged:

https://bitbucket.org/libgd/gd-libgd/downloads

It means I can't upload new releases, any idea?
fields.summary: not appeared logged in on the Download page (BB-8823)

fields.description:
I would be very helpful if the messages for each service can be edited using a template with certain placeholders for the dynamic information.

For example we use the HipChat service. But we don't use the HipChat web client, we use Jabber clients. So we see all the HTML in the Jabber group chat which is ugly. We could fix this if we would be able to modify the messages send by the hook.
fields.summary: Allow custom Templates for hooks (BB-8842)

fields.description:
Popular issues get a ton of comments on them containing simply:

bq. +1


In this instance, all the existing watchers on an issue get notified, followed by the obligatory comment from someone else:

bq. Please stop adding +1 - if you want to show your support for this issue add yourself as a watcher! You're doing nothing but annoying every other watcher of this issue.


To save everyone the bother, and to help actually reflect the intent of the "+1" comments, I propose comments containing only "+1" are converted to watchers rather than being added as a comment.

An example of a popular issue with this occurring in it:

https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/3288/remote-pull-requests-to-google-code-and
fields.summary: Automatically convert comments containing '+1' into a watcher
